Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix demand page to show live ADL demand with COALESCE fallback

Use COALESCE\(eta_runway_utc, eta_utc\) and COALESCE\(etd_runway_utc, etd_utc\)
to include flights that only have general ETA/ETD populated. Changed INNER
JOIN to LEFT JOIN on adl_flight_times to include flights without time
records. This ensures demand visualization shows all flights with any
available time estimate.

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add context-aware DP/STAR transition matching

Parser now selects the correct procedure transition based on route context:
- DPs: Look ahead at next FIX token to match transition \(e.g., SNIDR2.MOLLR\)
- STARs: Use last fix before STAR to match transition \(e.g., SHYRE.HOBTT3\)

Falls back to first matching transition if no context match found.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix duplicate waypoints from multi-source nav_fixes

After NAVDATA import, nav_fixes contained near-duplicate entries from
both points.csv and XPLANE sources with coordinates differing by ~0.0000001Â°.
This caused LEFT JOINs in SID/STAR/airway expansion to return multiple rows
per fix, doubling all waypoints \(84 instead of 48 for test flight\).

Changes:
- fn_ExpandAirway: Use ROW_NUMBER\(\) subquery to deduplicate fixes
- sp_ParseRoute: Create temp table #unique_fixes with one fix per name
- Priority order: points.csv > navaids.csv > XPLANE > other
- All SID/STAR expansion JOINs now use #unique_fixes

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(python -c "
import pymssql

conn = pymssql.connect\(server=''vatsim.database.windows.net'', user=''jpeterson'', password=''***REMOVED***'', database=''VATSIM_ADL'', tds_version=''7.3''\)
cursor = conn.cursor\(\)

print\(''=== ARCHIVE SYSTEM STATUS ===''\)
print\(\)

# Check trajectory data
cursor.execute\(''SELECT * FROM dbo.v_archive_stats''\)
print\(''Table                      Rows         Oldest               Newest               Tier''\)
print\(''-'' * 95\)
for row in cursor.fetchall\(\):
    print\(f''{row[0]:<25} {row[1]:>12,}  {str\(row[2]\)[:19]:<20} {str\(row[3]\)[:19]:<20} {row[4]}''\)

print\(\)

# Check recent archive log entries
cursor.execute\(''''''
    SELECT TOP 5 job_name, started_utc, status, rows_archived, rows_deleted, duration_ms
    FROM dbo.adl_archive_log ORDER BY started_utc DESC
''''''\)
rows = cursor.fetchall\(\)
if rows:
    print\(''=== RECENT ARCHIVE JOBS ===''\)
    print\(f''{""Job"":<35} {""Started"":<20} {""Status"":<10} {""Archived"":>10} {""Deleted"":>10} {""Duration"":>10}''\)
    print\(''-'' * 100\)
    for row in rows:
        print\(f''{row[0]:<35} {str\(row[1]\)[:19]:<20} {row[2]:<10} {row[3] or 0:>10} {row[4] or 0:>10} {row[5] or 0:>10}ms''\)
else:
    print\(''No archive jobs have run yet.''\)

print\(\)

# Test sp_Log_Trajectory
print\(''=== TESTING sp_Log_Trajectory ===''\)
cursor.execute\(''EXEC dbo.sp_Log_Trajectory''\)
result = cursor.fetchone\(\)
if result:
    print\(f''Status: {result[2]} | Positions logged: {result[0]} | Last log: {result[3]}s ago''\)
conn.commit\(\)

cursor.close\(\)
conn.close\(\)
print\(\)
print\(''Archive system is operational.''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import pymssql

conn = pymssql.connect\(server=''vatsim.database.windows.net'', user=''jpeterson'', password=''***REMOVED***'', database=''VATSIM_ADL'', tds_version=''7.3''\)
cursor = conn.cursor\(\)

# Fix sp_Log_Trajectory to properly log all active flights
fix_sql = ''''''
CREATE OR ALTER PROCEDURE dbo.sp_Log_Trajectory
    @force_log BIT = 0
AS
BEGIN
    SET NOCOUNT ON;

    DECLARE @log_interval_sec INT;
    DECLARE @last_log_utc DATETIME2\(0\);
    DECLARE @now DATETIME2\(0\) = SYSUTCDATETIME\(\);
    DECLARE @rows_logged INT = 0;
    DECLARE @seconds_since_last INT;

    -- Get configured interval
    SELECT @log_interval_sec = CAST\(config_value AS INT\)
    FROM dbo.adl_archive_config
    WHERE config_key = ''TRAJECTORY_LOG_INTERVAL_SEC'';

    SET @log_interval_sec = ISNULL\(@log_interval_sec, 60\);

    -- Check if enough time has passed since last log
    SELECT @last_log_utc = MAX\(recorded_utc\)
    FROM dbo.adl_flight_trajectory;

    IF @last_log_utc IS NOT NULL
        SET @seconds_since_last = DATEDIFF\(SECOND, @last_log_utc, @now\);
    ELSE
        SET @seconds_since_last = @log_interval_sec + 1;

    -- Skip if not time yet \(unless forced\)
    IF @force_log = 0 AND @seconds_since_last < @log_interval_sec
    BEGIN
        SELECT 0 AS positions_logged, NULL AS logged_at, ''SKIPPED'' AS status,
               @seconds_since_last AS seconds_since_last, @log_interval_sec AS interval_sec;
        RETURN;
    END

    -- Log current positions for all active flights
    INSERT INTO dbo.adl_flight_trajectory \(
        flight_uid,
        recorded_utc,
        lat,
        lon,
        altitude_ft,
        groundspeed_kts,
        vertical_rate_fpm,
        heading_deg,
        track_deg,
        source
    \)
    SELECT
        c.flight_uid,
        @now,
        p.lat,
        p.lon,
        p.altitude_ft,
        p.groundspeed_kts,
        p.vertical_rate_fpm,
        p.heading_deg,
        p.track_deg,
        ''vatsim''
    FROM dbo.adl_flight_core c
    JOIN dbo.adl_flight_position p ON p.flight_uid = c.flight_uid
    WHERE c.is_active = 1
      AND p.lat IS NOT NULL
      AND p.lon IS NOT NULL
      AND p.lat BETWEEN -90 AND 90
      AND p.lon BETWEEN -180 AND 180;

    SET @rows_logged = @@ROWCOUNT;

    SELECT @rows_logged AS positions_logged, @now AS logged_at, ''SUCCESS'' AS status,
           @seconds_since_last AS seconds_since_last, @log_interval_sec AS interval_sec;
END;
''''''

cursor.execute\(fix_sql\)
conn.commit\(\)
print\(''Fixed sp_Log_Trajectory procedure''\)

# Now test it
cursor.execute\(''EXEC dbo.sp_Log_Trajectory @force_log = 1''\)
result = cursor.fetchone\(\)
print\(f''Test result: {result[0]} positions logged, status: {result[2]}''\)
conn.commit\(\)

cursor.close\(\)
conn.close\(\)
")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix ADL normalized query excluding flights without position data

The normalized query in AdlQueryHelper was using INNER JOIN on
adl_flight_position, which excluded ~1100 flights that didn''t have
position data yet. Changed to LEFT JOIN to include all active flights.

Also added diagnostic queries to diagnose.php to help identify
flight count discrepancies between tables.
